title: Cake Decoration - Ideas and Techniques
headline: Dazzle your clients by mastering cake recipes and decoration techniques with this free online course.
description: Cake decoration is vital because the first impression matters in the cake business. Seldom do you attend birthday celebrations, weddings or any significant event without seeing an elaborate cake on display. Cake decorating uses ingredients such as icing and creative methods to make a plain cake more visually appealing. This course will teach you innovative ideas and strategies to get you started in cake decorating.
courseDescription:
Cake decorating is the art of creatively decorating cakes to attract customers or make a cake look delicious. Did you know that the first appearance of decorated cakes was in the sixteenth century during the reign of Englandâ€™s Queen Elizabeth I? This course will teach you the history and origin of baking cakes, their significance in those eras and how cakes and cake decorating have evolved. Baking is an art. It involves using the best tools and effectively utilising your time and expertise. Close care and attention to detail make the difference between good and memorable treats. Investigate the basic rules, ingredients, mixing techniques and correct size pans needed for baking. These will ensure that you produce a great-tasting cake.

There are several popular ways in which you decorate cakes. You can use marzipan, ganache, fondant and gum paste. We will examine these ingredients and teach you how to apply each. We will guide you step-by-step through different decorating recipes, ideas and techniques, using pictorial examples for each recipe. To be efficient in cake decorating, you must know how to stack a cake. We explore each step and the essential factors in learning. In addition, we provide a guide on piping and tips on successful cake writing fonts. Do you know the two most important aspects of cake decorating that determine the final appearance of the cake? Here's your chance to find out.

You identify decorated cakes with joyful celebrations. There's hardly an event without the appearance of elegantly adorned cakes. Cake decorating is a profitable business, requiring little capital, and you can start one from the comfort of your home. It's a beneficial skill anyone with a knack for creativity can acquire. We have designed this course to enable you to develop the basic knowledge you need to package your cakes in the most attractive ways. So whether you are looking forward to starting a cake decorating business, want to bake to mark special events for your loved ones or amp up your skills, you are on the right track. We have outlined everything you need to know to become successful. So enrol in this course today!

Start Course Now

•  Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Discuss the history of cake decorating.
    • Describe the rules of cake baking.
    • Recognize the basic ingredients of cake baking.
    • Outline the steps of baking a cake.
    • Estimate the preheat timeframe and note the correct oven temperature.
    • Identify popularly known recipes and how to make them.
    • Categorize cakes by ingredients and mixing method.
    • Explain the requirements for frosting and icing a cake.

  • Frosting and Icing

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary

    • Cakes are decorated to improve their visual appeal.
    • Decorated cakes made their first appearance during the reign of Great Britain's Elizabeth I.
    • Marzipan was chiefly a celebration food, considered both an inventive tool and a delicious confection.
    • Icing a sugar paste cake is far easier and faster than icing a cake in traditional royal icing.
    • Innate care and attention to detail make the difference between good baking and memorable baking.
    • The correct amount of whole eggs, egg yolks, or egg white is essential to the volume and texture of a cake.
    • Bake as close to the center of the oven as possible to allow for proper air circulation.
    • Sponge cakes, however, must be baked undisturbed, without opening the oven door until toward the very end of baking.
    • Tempering is a technique in which chocolate is stabilized through a melting and cooling process, thereby making it more malleable and glossy.
    • Any recipe for a cake that begins with 'cream butter and sugar' is a butter cake.
    • In a layer cake, it is important to make sure every layer is structurally sound and even.
    • Sponge cake contains no baking soda or baking powder but lots of whipped eggs or egg whites.
    • Frosting should be done at room temperature; cold frosting is difficult to spread.

  •  Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Recognize the various kinds of glazes used in cake decorating.
    • Distinguish between the ingredients for making the glazes.
    • Describe how to assemble a stacked cake.
    • Explain the different techniques of covering the cake boards.
    • Discuss piping techniques and how to choose piping nozzles.
    • Identify basic royal icing piping.
    • List cake writing styles.

  • Working with Glazes

  • Piping and Writing

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary

    • Glazes can be used to add a slight twist or tang to a cake that adds a pleasant element of surprise.
    • Apricot glaze is traditionally used for most white and butter cakes.
    • Mirror glaze should be cool but still liquid when poured onto delicate mousses.
    • Add the corn syrup and beat until incorporated for glaze in cookies.
    • Cook over low to medium heat for maple glaze.
    • It is best to make a large cake in separate sections, decorated separately, and then stack them on site.
    • Stacked cakes especially very tall ones must be stabilized to avoid tipping, sliding, or even caving in.
    • Fondant can be tinted, sponge painted, covered in pretty piping, and adorned with cut-outs.
    • Icing a finished board in royal icing extends the size of the cake and adds to its dimension.
    • Piping is when you force royal icing, buttercream, or melted chocolate out of a bag through a nozzle to create a message, add detail or texturize a cake.
    • A piping bag is a corn-shaped bag made out of plastic, fabric, or paper, used for piping royal icing, buttercream, and melted chocolate.
    • The simple round-tip nozzles come in standard sizes that indicate the opening's dimension.
    • The most widely used style in cake writing is simple to block lettering.
